Comment:
I like playing Nf3 because it has three important merits which I like:
1- it is flexible ... not committing myself to any pawn structure
2- directly gain two squares in the center d4 and e5
3- allows a faster king-side castling
I guess my opponent likes flexibility too
pushing a pawn to the center, clearing the way for the dark-squared bishop and threatening d5 which if not taken care of, will make the knight make an exhausting journey.
defending d5 and clearing the way for the dark-squared bishop
gaining a two-pawns center ... I think the center will be mine
countering my center superiority
gaining space

want to fianchetto the dark-bishop. It is not a bad move. But, I don't like it because black needs to remove my two center pawns before he can make use of the long dark diagonal ... which will require time
and also this move weakens the f7 pawn a little
attacking a center pawn from side ... this move also allows my queen access to the queen side
fianchetto
developing and adding more forces to guard the center
want to clear the way for the bishop to use the long diagonal
eating from side and attacking the knight
re-take
eating and attacking the bishop
re-take with development and guarding the center ... I think black achieved his plan of activating the dark-bishop
developing and clearing the way for castling
developing and putting the light-bishop on a good diagonal
king-side castling
clearing his back-rank and not committing himself to a specific type of castling
